Commentary: Mohammad Hafeez to Shahzaib Hasan, no run, tossed up on middle, grips and spins back in to hit Hasan high on the thigh pad as he looks to defend
Mohammad Hafeez to Shahzaib Hasan, no run, pushed through quicker on middle, Hasan is back inside the crease as he defends back down the pitch

Mohammad Hafeez to Shahzaib Hasan, OUT, poor, very very poor. Looks to hit this out of the stadium, but pick out Jordan, who has bucket hands, at long-on. Didn't get to the pitch of the ball as he stepped out, got more elevation than distance. As far as catches go, Jordan couldn't have asked for an easier one at the boundary.
Wicket: ['Shahzaib Hasan c Jordan b Mohammad Hafeez 0 (3b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0.00']

Commentary: Mohammad Hafeez to Gayle, 1 run, flatter one on middle and leg from around the stumps, turned wide of midwicket to get off the mark
Mohammad Hafeez to Babar Azam, no run, steps out but is still made to reach out, driven but straight to mid-off. Good flight from Hafeez
Mohammad Hafeez to Babar Azam, 1 run, works it with the spin to long-on. Excellent first over
Hasan Ali to Babar Azam, no run, gets this to shape away from outside off, left alone
Hasan Ali to Babar Azam, no run, angles one back in from wide of the crease, defended back with soft hands

Hasan Ali to Babar Azam, OUT, he dropped a sitter last night, but has more than made up for it now. Babar slashes, but can only manage a thick edge. Believe me, it was flying and looked almost certain to beat Sammy on the dive at slip, but no! He stretched full length to his right and plucked it out. Sensational stuff. What's even more amazing is that he held on even as his elbows touched the ground. What control, simply outstanding.
Hasan Ali to Sangakkara, 2 runs, starts off with a sumptuous cover drive. Leans forward and caresses it into the gap between cover and point. Lovely timing
Wicket: ['Babar Azam c Sammy b Hasan Ali 1 (5b 0x4 0x6) SR: 20.00']

Commentary: Hasan Ali to Sangakkara, 2 runs, slides a length ball into middle and leg, tucked away into the gap at deep backward square leg. Sanga up and away in a jiffy
Hasan Ali to Sangakkara, no run, solidly behind the line of that full delivery that jags away from middle.
Mohammad Hafeez to Gayle, no run, pushed through quicker on middle, defended back down the pitch

Mohammad Hafeez to Gayle, no run, look to fire this in but the ball slips out perhaps. Lobbed over Gayle's waist as he looks to swing this over deep midwicket, but couldn't generate much power. Surely a no-ball? Umpire doesn't think so. Hafeez quickly apologises
Mohammad Hafeez to Gayle, 1 run, eases it into the gap at cover and walks the single
Mohammad Hafeez to Sangakkara, no run, punched off the back foot to Boom Boom Afridi at extra cover
Mohammad Hafeez to Sangakkara, 1 run, fired in full on the pads, tucked to square leg
Mohammad Hafeez to Gayle, no run, drifting in from wide of the crease, Gayle gets a good stride forward to smother the spin

Jordan to Sangakkara, OUT, he's pulled this straight to midwicket, would you believe it? Jordan won't mind that. Not the kind of delivery that generally fetches you a wicket against a batsman of Sanga's class and quality, really. Short, he looks to take him on with the pull but didn't close the bat face. The timing was off as well and Hafeez managed to take it easily in front of square, near the umpire.
Jordan to Shoaib Malik, no run, nips away off the seam from off, defended carefully
Jordan to Shoaib Malik, no run, gets behind the line of that length ball and bunts it to mid-on
Wicket: ['KC Sangakkara c Mohammad Hafeez b Jordan 5 (6b 0x4 0x6) SR: 83.33']

Commentary: Jordan to Shoaib Malik, FOUR, delightful straight drive, shows the full face of the bat to ease that down the ground. It was a half-volley that deserved to be put away, superb balance from Malik
Jordan to Shoaib Malik, no run, angles a length ball into middle from wide of the crease, bunted back down the pitch
Jordan to Shoaib Malik, no run, uppish but on the bounce to the cover fielder
Mohammad Hafeez to Gayle, no run, gets forward and blocks the full-length delivery
Mohammad Hafeez to Gayle, no run, flatter and fuller on middle and leg, turned to short midwicket
Mohammad Hafeez to Gayle, no run, driven but straight to Morgan at cover. Pressure building. Is the release shot coming?

Mohammad Hafeez to Gayle, OUT, as plumb as they come, and this is a big moment in the match. Bowls the slider from around the stumps, Gayle plays for the turn but there is none. He's struck right in front of middle. That is a straightforward decision, really. You could sense Gayle was edgy, he's never comfortable facing the spinners early on, and the ploy of using Hafeez has worked for Sammy. Karachi in tatters now
Mohammad Hafeez to Bopara, 2 runs, cut away, into the gap between cover and point. Too short and he picked the length early
Mohammad Hafeez to Bopara, 1 run, slides one on off stump, punched past point for a quick single
Hasan Ali to Bopara, 2 runs, delightful square drive on the up, third man comes around with a tumbling stop. That was travelling
Wicket: ['CH Gayle lbw b Mohammad Hafeez 2 (9b 0x4 0x6) SR: 22.22']

Commentary: Hasan Ali to Bopara, FOUR, thick edge, and Kamran Akmal has failed to get his gloves to it. Reacted late, but it was still a catch. Poor footwork, you have to say. This was definitely the keeper's catch. Reprieve for Bopara

Hasan Ali to Bopara, FOUR, what does Bopara do to add insult to injury? Hops back and whips a length ball on middle into the square leg boundary. Sensational timing and use of the bottom hand to generate power
Hasan Ali to Bopara, 1 run, stretches forward, opens the bat face slightly and eases this behind point
Hasan Ali to Shoaib Malik, 1 run, looks to play a flat-batted pull, but the ball got big on him. Toe-ended it to short midwicket
Hasan Ali to Bopara, 1 run, mixes his pace up with an off cutter, Bopara taps it towards point and scampers across for a quick single
Shahid Afridi to Bopara, 1 run, turned with the angle to midwicket
Shahid Afridi to Shoaib Malik, 1 run, drifts in a short ball that spins away a touch from middle, punched to long-on
Shahid Afridi to Bopara, 1 run, too short, crunched off the back foot to sweeper cover as they jog the single
Shahid Afridi to Shoaib Malik, no run, slider that beats Malik's attempted whip, hit high on the left pad
Shahid Afridi to Shoaib Malik, no run, tossed up outside off, there's a bit of grip and turn, driven to point this time
Shahid Afridi to Shoaib Malik, 1 run, pushed to point, the non-striker called for the run and made it in the nick of time. The throw wasn't the best one either.
Wahab Riaz to Shoaib Malik, 1 run, slips in a length ball across the batsman, punched to deep point
Wahab Riaz to Bopara, no run, play and a miss. Short and angling away, looked to ease it behind point but was beaten for pace
Wahab Riaz to Bopara, no run, uppish drive, but on the bounce to backward point

Wahab Riaz to Bopara, no run, slower delivery, the batsman is deceived and pokes at the away-going delivery. There was some noise, some deivation too. Sammy went up in an appeal, Wahab ran through the length of the pitch, but Kamran Akmal didn't appeal. Perhaps he thought there was nothing. Umpire wasn't convinced either.
Wahab Riaz to Bopara, no run, flayed away but an outstanding stop at backward point by Hafeez
Wahab Riaz to Bopara, 1 run, controls the pull nicely, down to deep square leg
Shahid Afridi to Bopara, 1 run, drifts in a short ball on middle, he makes room and crunches it to deep point
Shahid Afridi to Shoaib Malik, 2 runs, gets to the pitch of the ball and eases it into the gap behind square on the off side
Shahid Afridi to Shoaib Malik, 1 run, flipper this time on middle, he's hurried into an attempted push, just about manages to get some bat on it as it rolls to Afridi's right, they steal a single
Shahid Afridi to Bopara, 1 run, too full and down the leg side, nurdled to square leg
Shahid Afridi to Shoaib Malik, no run, grip, turn and bounce, he gets on top of the bounce and defends it back down the pitch
Shahid Afridi to Shoaib Malik, 1 run, misfield at point allows a single
Jordan to Shoaib Malik, 1 run, short of length delivery that rears up on off stump, Malik gets on top of the bounce and fends it to the off side
Jordan to Bopara, 1 leg bye, errs in line, slides this down leg but is lucky to get away. Bopara looks to flick behind square but can only get some pad on it as they take a run off the deflection

Jordan to Shoaib Malik, FOUR, pulled imperiously! Just fractionally short, Malik was ready for it as he put that away in front of square. Little press forward, then swivelled back and found his timing
Jordan to Shoaib Malik, 1 run, uses the pace of the bowler to steer this down to third man
Jordan to Bopara, no run, off-cutter this time, not much change in action, defended back gently
Jordan to Bopara, 1 run, short, wide and he's crunched that to deep point
Shahid Afridi to Bopara, no run, peach of a delivery that squares Bopara up. Plenty of fizz, this drifted in and spun away past the shoulder of the bat
Shahid Afridi to Bopara, no run, fired into middle from wide of the crease, squeezed back down the pitch
Shahid Afridi to Bopara, no run, too full to cut, still goes through with the shot and finds point

Shahid Afridi to Bopara, no run, play and a miss. This one's much slower through the air, plenty of revs as the ball pitches and beats Bopara's feeble push. Akmal breaks the stumps and appeals for a stumping. Bopara's back foot that was in the air for a second or so is back inside the crease.
Shahid Afridi to Bopara, 1 run, too full on the pads, driven to long-on
Shahid Afridi to Shoaib Malik, 1 run, turned to the right of Afridi, who runs across towards short midwicket
Mohammad Asghar to Shoaib Malik, no run, sees the batsman stepping out and fires this in, Malik blocks it with his pad
Mohammad Asghar to Shoaib Malik, 2 runs, too short, he makes room and cuts this into the gap at deep extra cover
Mohammad Asghar to Shoaib Malik, 1 run, full toss on the pads, turned to long-on
Mohammad Asghar to Bopara, no run, draws him forward, and beats him in flight and dip. Back foot just inside as Akmal whipped the bails off. Superb delivery
Mohammad Asghar to Bopara, no run, leading edge that rolls past the bowler, just short of him. He's beating Bopara in drift here
Mohammad Asghar to Bopara, 1 run, gets forward and bunts this into the gap at cover
Shahid Afridi to Bopara, 1 run, too close to cut, goes through with the shot. Morgan moves to his right to cut that off
Shahid Afridi to Shoaib Malik, 1 run, fired full from wide of the crease, turned to short midwicket
Shahid Afridi to Bopara, 1 run, steps out but Afridi fires this full and wide, Bopara adjusts and taps it towards point and scampers across for a single
Shahid Afridi to Shoaib Malik, 1 run, looks to go down town but got too close to the delivery, squeezed to long-on
Shahid Afridi to Bopara, no run, jabbed hard to cover. Afridi is mixing his pace quite well here
Shahid Afridi to Bopara, no run, nearly chips a return catch. Looks to work it across the line, this one spun away just a touch and lands in front of Afridi, off a leading edge.
Mohammad Asghar to Shoaib Malik, 1 run, drifting into middle and leg, punched to deep midwicket
Mohammad Asghar to Bopara, no run, backs away to go over cover, but the bowler cleverly tosses this up well outside off, left alone
Mohammad Asghar to Bopara, no run, sweeps and misses. Had to fetch it from well outside off
Mohammad Asghar to Bopara, 1 run, fierce sweep shot down to deep backward square leg
Mohammad Asghar to Shoaib Malik, 1 run, steps out and punches the in-drifter to long-off
Mohammad Asghar to Bopara, 1 run, whipped across the line to deep midwicket, the 50-stand is up
Wahab Riaz to Bopara, 1 run, flayed away on the up to sweeper cover
Wahab Riaz to Shoaib Malik, 1 run, chops this down to third man for an easy single. Wahab is looking to bang them in short
Wahab Riaz to Bopara, 1 run, pulled in front of square, but straight to deep midwicket
Wahab Riaz to Shoaib Malik, 1 run, dabs it late and gets it down to third man again
Wahab Riaz to Bopara, FOUR, short, he gets into position early and thumps it in front of square. Back-of-the-hand slower delivery, enough time to play the pull.
Wahab Riaz to Bopara, no run, steps out to go over cover, Wahab sees him coming and bangs it short outside off, Bopara sways out of the way
Mohammad Asghar to Shoaib Malik, 1 run, heaved across the line to deep midwicket

Mohammad Asghar to Bopara, OUT, didn't get underneath the flight, but went through with the inside-out stroke. Wanted to hit it over cover, but ended up giving catching practice to Jordan at long-off. Credit to the bowler for being brave and tossing the ball up in the end overs. This may not be a bad thing after all from Karachi's point of view.
Mohammad Asghar to Shoaib Malik, 1 run, looks to whip this away, looks like he managed a bit of inside edge, down to short fine leg as they complete a quick single

Mohammad Asghar to Pollard, SIX, lofted straight down the ground and into the first tier. Long-on was a mere spectator. Pollard didn't look happy at being told what to do. Took out the anger on the ball.
Mohammad Asghar to Pollard, 1 run, grip and turn from off stump, bunted to the off side for a quick single

Mohammad Asghar to Shoaib Malik, SIX, another biggie. This one's too full, he advances, gets underneath the flight and boom! Over long-on again. Sania Mirza, in the stands, gives her nod of approval to the shot. Excellent use of the feet to get to the pitch of the ball.
Wicket: ['RS Bopara c Jordan b Mohammad Asghar 33 (40b 3x4 0x6) SR: 82.50']

Commentary: Hasan Ali to Pollard, 1 leg bye, shuffles across to whip this length ball, deflects off the body to the leg side. Hit near the ribcage
Hasan Ali to Shoaib Malik, 1 run, cut away towards the man coming in from deep point
Hasan Ali to Pollard, 1 run, pulled but didn't get hold of it as much as he would have liked, long-on comes in quickly to cut that off

Hasan Ali to Shoaib Malik, 2 runs, top edge and put down by Afridi, who was running back from short fine leg. The ball was swirling around for a long time, he did well to keep his eyes on the ball, but somehow lost control as it was descending rapidly. Got a touch away from him too and he grassed it in the end.
Hasan Ali to Shoaib Malik, FOUR, makes room and slaps the short ball into the cover boundary. Pure muscle
Hasan Ali to Shoaib Malik, 1 run, right into the blockhole, drilled to long-on

Wahab Riaz to Shoaib Malik, OUT, looked to swing this over long-on, could only manage a thin nick through to the keeper. Wahab is quick. This was full and angling away, Malik was completely beaten for pace. End of a handy knock nevertheless
Wahab Riaz to Imad Wasim, no run, defended to point, sharp work by the fielder there. Can't get a single

Wahab Riaz to Imad Wasim, OUT, why would you try to go for the big hits when all you need to do is give strike to Pollard? Beyond me. Wasim looks to make room and go over cover, the bounce does the trick this time. He gets it high on the bat and Sammy, running backwards from mid-off, hangs on.
Wahab Riaz to Pollard, 1 run, uses the pace and angle of the bowler to ease this down to third man
Wahab Riaz to Mohammad Amir, no run, digs one in short on middle, fended to the off side
Wahab Riaz to Mohammad Amir, 1 run, eased past the bowler, Amir wanted the run, Pollard didn't but reluctantly managed to get across. Not-so-good match awareness from Amir this time.
Jordan to Mohammad Amir, 1 run, flays an away-going length delivery to deep point

Jordan to Pollard, SIX, Wahab at fine leg was briefly in business, but this was struck really well by Pollard. Sailed over the ropes. Too short, he was in position quickly and pulled him behind square.
Wicket: ['Imad Wasim c Sammy b Wahab Riaz 0 (2b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0.00']

Commentary: Jordan to Pollard, 1 run, hit really hard but Jordan, on his followthrough, gets some hand on it and deflects it down to long-on
Jordan to Mohammad Amir, no run, swing and a miss. Off-cutter this time at length from Jordan
Jordan to Mohammad Amir, 1 run, full toss outside off, flayed to sweeper cover

Jordan to Pollard, 1 run, full and straight outside off, Pollard squeezes this to deep cover and puts his hand out immediately, as if to suggest one is all that he will run for it. Keeps strike for the start of the final over
Wahab Riaz to Pollard, no run, pulled but on the bounce to deep backward square leg. Pollard refuses the single
Wahab Riaz to Pollard, FOUR, swings north, ball goes south. Wanted to pull in front of square, ended up getting a top-edge that flew over the keeper's head
Wahab Riaz to Pollard, no run, pulls and misses. Kamran cops a blow on his knee as he looks to gather it on the bounce
Wahab Riaz to Pollard, 2 runs, muscled into the deep square leg region, two men back in the deep but can't prevent the second as the throw was weak
Wahab Riaz to Pollard, no run, pulled in front of square, straight to deep midwicket

Wahab Riaz to Pollard, FOUR, this is precisely why he refused the single off the previous delivery. Too short, this was also a slower variation which Pollard read off the hand, waited and then rolled his wrists over the pull to pick the gap at deep backward square leg
